metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7470 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
cipso_v4_validate in include/net/cipso_ipv4.h in the Linux kernel before 3.11.7, when CONFIG_NETLABEL is disabled, allows attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and crash), as demonstrated by icmpsic, a different vulnerability than CVE-2013-0310.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7470` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.12.0-1-generic - 3.12.0-1.3
linux-image-3.12.0-1-generic-lpae - 3.12.0-1.3
linux-image-extra-3.12.0-1-generic - 3.12.0-1.3
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1044-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.12.0-1-generic - 3.12.0-1.3
linux-image-3.12.0-1-generic-lpae - 3.12.0-1.3
